references.paper_title: PaLM: Scaling language modeling with pathways
references.reason: This paper introduces PaLM, a large language model that is foundational to the INSTRUCTCELL architecture, demonstrating the capabilities of LLMs in interpreting and processing complex natural language instructions.

references.paper_title: LLaMA: Open and efficient foundation language models
references.reason: This paper introduces LLaMA, another crucial LLM that serves as a backbone for INSTRUCTCELL, highlighting the importance of efficient and open-source LLMs in advancing multi-modal AI copilots.

references.paper_title: Multitask prompted training enables zero-shot task generalization
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the effectiveness of multi-task prompted training, a core method in INSTRUCTCELL's training strategy, underscoring the importance of this methodology for enhanced adaptability and robustness in single-cell analysis.

references.paper_title: scBERT: a large-scale pretrained deep language model for cell type annotation of single-cell RNA-seq data
references.reason: This paper introduces scBERT, a significant single-cell foundation model, highlighting the importance of using pre-trained LLMs to enhance performance in single-cell analysis and providing a benchmark model for INSTRUCTCELL's performance comparison.

references.paper_title: scGPT: toward building a foundation model for single-cell multi-omics using generative AI
references.reason: This paper introduces scGPT, another prominent single-cell foundation model, used for benchmark comparison and further illustrating the trend of using generative AI in processing single-cell data, similar to INSTRUCTCELL.
